Swedish diplomats visit Mt. Jongbang 
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Paul Beijer and other officials of the Swedish embassy here visited the Mt. Jongbang recreation ground located in North Hwanghae Province yesterday on the occasion of the National Day of the Kingdom of Sweden.
 Being briefed on the fact that the mountain has turned into a famous scenic spot and a peculiar recreation ground for people, the guests looked round with keen interest an angling site, the Jongbang teashop, the Songbul temple and a 5-tier pagoda erected in 898 and other places.

Reception given by British Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- David Arthur Slinn, British Ambassador to the DPRK, hosted a reception on an excursion ship on the Taedong River on June 17 on the occasion of the official birthday of the Queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
 Present on invitation were vice-minister of foreign affairs Choe Su Hon, Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Kim Yong Sul, Vice-Chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok, director of the general bureau of diplomatic corps affairs Choe Su Il and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries here.    
 Speeches were made there.

Greetings to Nepalese Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, June 18 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Surya Bahadur Thapa upon his appointment as Prime Minister of Nepal.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished him success in his responsible work.
